segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose the earth was entirely covered with water.
And a person threw a yoke with a single hole into it.

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ puratthimo vāto pacchimena saṃhareyya, pacchimo vāto puratthimena saṃhareyya, uttaro vāto dakkhiṇena saṃhareyya, dakkhiṇo vāto uttarena saṃhareyya.
segments.en: The east wind wafts it west; the west wind wafts it east; the north wind wafts it south; and the south wind wafts it north.

segments.pli: Tatrassa kāṇo kacchapo. So vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṃ sakiṃ ummujjeyya.
segments.en: And there was a one-eyed turtle who popped up once every hundred years.

segments.pli: api nu kho kāṇo kacchapo vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṃ sakiṃ ummujjanto amusmiṃ ekacchiggaḷe yuge gīvaṃ paveseyyā”ti?
segments.en: Would that one-eyed turtle, popping up once every hundred years, still poke its neck through the hole in that yoke?”

segments.pli: “Adhiccamidaṃ, bhante, yaṃ so kāṇo kacchapo vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena sakiṃ sakiṃ ummujjanto amusmiṃ ekacchiggaḷe yuge gīvaṃ paveseyyā”ti.

segments.en: “That’s how unlikely it is to get reborn as a human being.

segments.pli: Evaṃ adhiccamidaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho.
segments.en: And that’s how unlikely it is for a Realized One to arise in the world, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: Evaṃ adhiccamidaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgatappavedito dhammavinayo loke dibbati.
segments.en: And that’s how unlikely it is for the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One to shine in the world.

segments.pli: Tassidaṃ, bhikkhave, manussattaṃ laddhaṃ, tathāgato loke uppanno arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, tathāgatappavedito ca dhammavinayo loke dibbati.
segments.en: And now, mendicants, you have been reborn as a human being. A Realized One has arisen in the world, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. And the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One shines in the world.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

sections.title: “Mendicants, suppose the earth was entirely covered with water.…

suttaplex.blurb: A blind turtle would put its head through a yoke with a hole in it floating in the ocean sooner than someone in the lower realms would be reborn as a human.
